thread.title: ABQ BioPark loses second lion after companion’s death
thread.title_full: ABQ BioPark loses second lion after companion’s death | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Journal staff and wire reports
title: ABQ BioPark loses second lion after companion’s death
text:
The ABQ BioPark lost its second lion Friday morning when 19-year-old Sarabi died of a ruptured splenic tumor, according to a park veterinarian.
Sarabi had been suffering from ongoing renal failure, which is a common ailment in large cats, said Ralph Zimmerman, a senior veterinarian. She began doing poorly last November due to a compromised kidney, and the staff increased her vitamins and potassium supplements, he said.
Senior zookeeper Tony York said Sarabi seemed to improve but fell ill again once her companion, Cosmo, 18, died in August.
“Once Cosmo passed, she wasn’t the same,” he said. “She was lonely and was reluctant to come into the den.”
Sarabi came to the BioPark four years ago from Texas as a companion to Cosmo. Nineteen years is an average lifespan for a big cat in captivity, Zimmerman said, and those in the wild live an average of 10 to 14 years.
